Description.val:
FY 2020 funding totals include $0.0M for Base and $57.473M for Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO); of which $55.543M is realigned as part of the OCO for Base Requirements.  FY 2020 OCO for Base Requirements is OCO funding for base budget requirements in support of the National Defense Strategy.  The Budget requests these funds in OCO to comply with the base budget defense caps included in the Budget Control Act of 2011.

The family of mortar cartridges includes all 60mm mortar cartridges and 81mm mortar cartridges which consist of high explosive, smoke, illumination and full range training practice rounds.  The 60mm mortar cartridges are fired from the M224 lightweight mortar system to provide close-in indirect fire support of group troops at ranges of approximately 70 to 3,500 meters.  The 81mm mortar cartridges are fired from the M252 medium weight mortar system to provide long-range indirect fire support to infantry units at ranges of approximately 100 to 6,000 meters.

Justification.val:
FY 2020 OCO for baseline funding will support procurement of 60mm Full Range Training Practice Cartridges 60mm (DODIC BA15), 81mm (DODIC C875) Full Range Practice Cartridges (FRPC) and the new 81MM High Explosive round (DODIC CA66) in support of baseline training munitions requirements for lightweight mortar systems.

The budget increase FY 2019 to FY 2020 is due to increased live fire training requirements for BA15 and CA66 ammunition.

OCO: 
FY 2020 Direct War OCO funding request of $1.930M will support replenishment of 81MM High Explosive Mortars (CA66) expended in support of Operation Inherent Resolve (OIR).

Remarks.val:
[Hardware] The 81MM High Explosive round with the more reliable Multi-Option Fuze(DODIC CA63) replaces the 81MM High Explosive (HE)Point Detonation (DODIC CA62).

[Hardware] All C875 contract awards in January and February of FY18 were awarded with Army funding. The USMC funding was sent in May 2018 after the CRA was lifted.
